messages.title: HOW WE WILL SECURE A BETTER FUTURE FOR YOU, YOUR FAMILY AND OUR COUNTRY

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Eliminate the deficit and start paying down our debts
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Control welfare spending, reduce waste, invest in important public services like the NHS and schools, and keep our economy healthy and secure.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Back business to create a job for everyone who wants one
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Keep job's taxes low and cut red tape, deliver 3 million new apprenticeships, and aim for full employment and the highest ever number of EU immigrants with an in/out EU referendum by the end of 2017.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Cut income tax for 30 million people, and ensure everyone pays their fair share
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Take everyone who earns less than £12,500 out of the income tax altogether, increase the 40p tax threshold so that no one earning less than £50,000 pays it, and increase the tax on very high earners to avoid extreme income and tax evasion.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Provide good schools and help families with childcare costs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure a good primary school place for every child, turn around failing secondary schools, support teachers and improve maths, science and English, and provide more support for childcare and a tax cut for over four million married couples.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Give everyone the chance to have a home of their own
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Keep mortgage rates low so families are able to afford home ownership, help 200,000 new Starter Homes for first-time buyers under 40, and extend the Help-to-Buy scheme.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Help protect and secure people in their retirement
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Continue to increase the State Pension and protect pensioner benefits like the winter fuel payment, give people freedom over their pension pots, and make sure no-one is forced to sell their home to pay for care.

issues.brexitEurope: in/out EU referendum by the end of 2017
issues.economy: Eliminate the deficit and start paying down our debts. Back business to create jobs.
issues.education: Provide good schools for every child, improve maths, science, and English education, and support teachers.
issues.governance: Control welfare spending, reduce waste, and aim for full employment.
issues.health: Invest in important public services like the NHS.
issues.immigration: The highest number of EU immigrants with an in/out EU referendum by the end of 2017.
issues.socialWelfare: Protect pensioner benefits like winter fuel payment.

housing.content: Keep mortgage rates low so families are able to afford home ownership, help 200,000 new Starter Homes for first-time buyers under 40, and extend the Help-to-Buy scheme.

images.caption: STRONG LEADERSHIP. A CLEAR ECONOMIC PLAN. A BETTER, MORE SECURE FUTURE.
